page.title: 06Hope Chapel, Blackboys.
page.content: This Strict Baptist Chapel was built in 1875. It stands near a main road but once through the wrought iron gates, the visitor is aware of the peace of the environment. Apart from one house adjoining the Chapel there are no houses visible, only rough pasture land and trees. There is a small car park at the rear for the congregation but on Sundays, when the chapel is very well attended, people have to park their cars on the grass verges of the road. People from three or four miles distance come to worship here. There are two services on Lord's Day, Sunday: one at 10.45am and a later one at 1.45pm. On alternate Wednesdays there is an evening service at 7.00pm while on Tuesday evenings prayer meetings are held. A small graveyard is neatly kept with horse chestnut trees marking each corner.
